stages.logText: You entered a classroom in Brimhaven's school. The teacher told you to sit down.
You noticed an evil looking statue in a corner. Who on earth puts such an ugly, hideous thing into a school?
You found a free place next to Golin.
The teacher was droning endlessly about Brimhaven history.
Then a practice lesson started.
Everyone should take a set of practicing weapons of the chest and sit down again.
You should look for a dueling partner.
You started a fight with Golin.
You started a fight with Golin and killed him.
You started a fight with Golin, but you broke off the duel. Very good.
You tried to fight a pupil, but they all ran away screaming.
You started a fight with the teacher.
You started a fight with the teacher and killed her.
You started a fight with the teacher, but you broke off the duel. Very good.
You feel the evil stare the mascot.
The evil grinning mascot suddenly grew to incredible size and attacked you!
You killed the evil mascot.
The teacher thanked you for saving him. School would be over for you. You could go to the baker and get a cake for good performance.
You cheated with the duel. The teacher noticed it and banned you from school.
The teacher was very satisfied with your performance in the duel. School would be over for you. You could go to the baker and get a cake for good performance.
The teacher sent you away, because you killed Golin in the duel.
You fond two not too bright brothers in a cellar of their house. They seemed to be talking about some sinister plan.
They were planning to destroy the great dam of Brimhaven. They just could not agree how they would do it.
They asked you to help them.
You agreed to destroy the dam for them.
They gave you a hand ax that could weaken the dam in a vulnerable place.
You found the weak spot in the dam and started hacking on the wood.
Water came pouring through the hole in the dam. Much water!
You refused to destroy the dam for them.
With your knowledge, you were not allowed to leave. The two brothers attacked you.
You were arrested while leaving the city. Someone had destroyed the dam, and all suspects would have to be interrogated by the guard's captain.
You promised to track down the real perpetrators and have been released for the time being. However, you should not leave the city.
The two brothers did not know their client. But he seemed to have a lot of gold.
The rich man living up on the hill of Brimhaven seemed to know more than he admitted.
The rich man boasted that he had been bribed by the mayor of Loneford, for to sabotate the dam.
End
You run around in classroom.
Talked to Golin.
Dueled Golin with school weapons.
Talked to the statue.
Reward: cake
Pupils ran out
